title: Vicious thug shoves woman headfirst into a train at a packed station

The moment a violent thug shoved a woman into a train at a busy station was caught on camera.

The disturbing clip shows the latest in a string of unprovoked attacks on innocent people lately in New York City.

In it, the vile yob jumps up and down on the platform at Dekalb Avenue subway station in Brooklyn and shouts "what" several times.

He then lunges at the woman from behind and pushes her with both hands.

The woman tumbles and falls face-first into the side of the stationary train.

Police were called to the station on Wednesday at around 7.30pm but the man remains on the run.

It is understood the man had a previous dispute with a commuter just moments before the shocking attack.

(Image: @sabel_brooke/Twitter)

(Image: @sabel_brooke/Twitter)

The fire service says it received a call from an "emotionally disturbed" woman but did not find a victim at the scene.

The full extent of the woman's injuries are not yet known.

It comes after a police officer in New York City was wounded after a violent struggle with an armed and naked suspect on Wednesday in an unrelated incident.

The 34-year-old victim was rushed to hospital.

(Image: @sabel_brooke/Twitter)

Eight officers responded to the building in the Harlem area shortly before 2am after receiving a 911 call from a resident saying a man was harassing her, banging on doors and breaking glass.

The naked suspect, who was armed with a gun, was killed when police exchanged gunfire.

The injured officer's bullet-proof vest stopped the bullet from penetrating his body.
description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT The unprovoked attack happened at Dekalb Avenue subway station in Brooklyn, New York City
